channel.title: Item Requires Membership

item.title: Item Requires Membership
item.dc:creator: @KillinXxSMile KillinXxSMile
item.description:
@KillinXxSMile wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:7, topic:269076”][quote author=Your Master link=topic=355120.msg2719596#msg2719596 date=1237886235]

if(wearID == 1323 && playerIsMember == 0){
sendMessage(“You Must Be A Member To Equipt This Item”);
return false;
}

easyfix ;0
[/quote]I dont call that a easy fix. It should look like:

[code]if(wearID == 1323 && playerIsMember == 0){
sendMessage(“You Must Be A Member To Equipt This Item”);
return false;

} [/code] This is the real. Allways 1 space down, before putting a bracket.

LOL??? You’re too funny.

On Topic -
You need to declare ‘playerIsMember’.[/quote]
most servers already have that declared but yeah i guess your right

and as for mr your master, the way i put codes is my choice.
there is no “proper” way, everybody codes differently.

Read full topic

if(wearID == 1323 && playerIsMember == 0){
sendMessage(“You Must Be A Member To Equipt This Item”);
return false;
}

easyfix ;0
[/quote]I dont call that a easy fix. It should look like:

[code]if(wearID == 1323 && playerIsMember == 0){
sendMessage(“You Must Be A Member To Equipt This Item”);
return false;

} [/code] This is the real. Allways 1 space down, before putting a bracket.[/quote]
LOL??? You’re too funny.

On Topic -
You need to declare ‘playerIsMember’ in your player class.

public int playerIsMember;

item.title: Item Requires Membership
item.dc:creator: @Elux Elux
item.description:
@Elux wrote:

Hey im trying to make it so my items require players to have membership
Ive added this

if(wearID == 8002 && isMember == 0){
sM(“You Must Be A Member To Equipt This Item”);
return false;
}

Under

public boolean wear(int wearID, int slot) {

Where all the other wearids are ive got the

public boolean isMember;

in player class

but it comes up with this error.

[QUOTE]client.java:21056: incomparable types: boolean and int
if(wearID == 8002 && isMember == 0){
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/QUOTE]

Any ideas how to fix ?

Thanks,
Elux

Read full topic
